ATTENTION
Si votre siège est situé dans une rangée à la hauteur d'une des issues de l'appareil et que vous ne lisez, parlez ni ne com-
prenez langlais, ou que vous ne comprenez pas les symboles graphiques, ou que vous ne comprenez pas les instructions
orales de l'équipage en anglais, signalez-le au personnel de bord et demandez qu'une nouvelle place vous soit assignée.
il ongleeson pur canagad un sia de en serie site nominde le se jani ral emparite in a
inglese dal personale di volo, chiedete la riassegnazione del posto ad un addistente di volo.
Si su asiento está en la fila de una de las salidas, y usted no lee, habla, ni entiende el idioma inglés, o si no entiende los
símbolos gráficos ni las instrucciones orales en inglés de la tripulación, pida al personal de a bordo que se le asigne otro
asiento.
If you are seated in an exit row seat, you may be called upon to assist in an emergency. Follow the directions of the crew.
Read this card carefully. Emergency exits are heavy and may be difficult to manipulate. You must be willing and able to
perform all the functions shown and described.
• Locate the emergency exit, recognize the emergency exit opening mechanism and comprehend the instructions for
operating the emergency exit. Determine if opening the emergency exit is safe (smoke, fire, debris, etc.).
• Operate the emergency exit. Secure the emergency exit door so that it will not impede use of the exit.
• Follow oral directions and hand signals given by the crew.
• Activate the slide, pass quickly through the emergency exit, and stabilize the slide after deployment to help others in
getting off the slide.
• Select and follow a safe path away from the emergency exit.
No passenger may be seated in an exit row seat if it is likely they are unable to perform one or more of the functions
because:
• The easiales han 1 il co fan or, aks h caper ta perform one or more of the applicable functions with-
• The person lacks sufficient mobility, strength, or dexterity in both arms and hands, and both legs to:
— reach the emergency exits quickly
- reach upward, sideways, downward to the location of emergency exit and exit-slide operating mechanism
- grasp and push, pull, turn, or otherwise manipulate those mechanisms and open emergency exits
— lift out, hold, deposit on nearby seats, or maneuver over the seatbacks to the next row objects the size and
weight of over-wing window exit doors (25-55 Ibs.)
— remove obstructions similar in size and weight to over-wing doors
— maintain balance while removing obstructions
— move expeditiously through the exit
— stabilize an escape slide and assist others in getting off the slide
• The person cannot read, speak, and understand instructions provided related to emergency evacuation in the English
language or graphic form
• The person cannot understand spoken crew commands and impart information verbally to other passengers in English
• The aion cant son ael nough coplaform one or more of the applicable functions without the asistance of
• The person cannot hear well enough to hear and understand instructions shouted by crew members without assis-
tance beyond a hearing aid
• The person has a condition or responsibilites, such as caring for small children, that might prevent them from per-
forming one or more of the applicable functions
• The person has a condition that might cause them harm if they perform one or more of the applicable functions
Contact a flight attendant for reseating if:
1) You cannot meet the selection criteria
2) You have a nondiscernible condition that will prevent you from performing the applicable functions
3) You may suffer bodily harm as the result of performing one or more of the functions
4) You do not wish to perform the functions
It is not necessary to explain why you need reseating.
Please observe the fasten seat belt and the no smoking signs.
Federal law prohibits tampering with, disabling, or destroying any smoke detector in an airplane lavatory.
TWA S/N 646247
PN 4963 (2/00)

properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by TWA (Trans World Airlines) for Boeing 727; double-sided tri-fold card with illustrations and text demonstrating safety instructions and emergency procedures; information code S/N 646247 PN 4963, dated 2/00.
